sources.data_found: Current Aries cluster: 1208 cores total, 2 V100 GPU nodes. New HPC funded by NSF (award #2430236) ModernCARE: 3 GPU nodes with 2 NVIDIA L40S (48GB) each; 2 H100 (80GB) GPU nodes with 2 GPUs each.
Saint Louis University has total enrollment of 17,202 including 10,519 undergraduate students and 6,683 graduate students (2023-2024).
New graduate enrollment has climbed by 28.6%, with steady growth in graduate programs such as artificial intelligence, bioinformatics, computer science and supply chain management.
During 2021-2022 academic year: 42 bachelor's degrees in computer & information sciences. In 2022, 23 students received their master's degree in computer & information sciences from SLU.

student_data.notes: CS enrollment estimated from degree completion data: 42 bachelor's degrees in CS (2021-2022) × 4 years = 168 undergraduate CS majors. MS CS: 23 MS degrees (2022) × 2 years = 46 MS students. PhD CS estimated: approximately 3 PhD completions/year × 5 years = 15 PhD students. Total university enrollment confirmed at 17,202 (10,519 undergrad, 6,683 grad) for 2023-2024.

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology: 8 GPU servers × 4 GPUs each = 32 GPUs. Model not specified.

gpu_resources.notes: CURRENT SYSTEMS: Aries cluster has 2 V100 GPU nodes (assuming 1 GPU per node = 2 V100s). NEW SYSTEMS (NSF ModernCARE grant #2430236): 3 GPU nodes × 2 NVIDIA L40S (48GB) each = 6 L40S; 2 H100 nodes × 2 H100 (80GB) each = 4 H100 (counted as PCIe since not specified as SXM). ADDITIONAL: Biochemistry Dept has 32 GPUs (model unspecified) across 8 servers.

analysis_notes: SLU has modest GPU resources with 2 older V100s in current Aries cluster. Major upgrade coming via NSF ModernCARE grant adding 4 H100s and 6 L40S GPUs. Additional 32 GPUs in Biochemistry dept but model unknown. CS program appears relatively small with ~229 total students across all degree levels.
